body_content.explanation: to enter a country by force with large numbers of soldiers in order to take possession of it again:
examples: The country was in chaos and the French were threatening to reinvade.
The president ordered troops to re-invade the island.

body_content.explanation: to come back to a place in large numbers, usually when unwanted and in order to take possession or do damage:
examples: Thousands of gold prospectors re-invaded the region.
When the temperature rose again, swarms of flies reinvaded the coast.
